thread.title: Colin Jost is not the head writer for 'SNL' anymore
thread.title_full: Colin Jost is not the head writer for 'SNL' anymore - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Colin Jost is not the head writer for 'SNL' anymore
text:
Dana Edelson/NBC Colin Jost during 'Weekend Update' on 'SNL.' He's just an anchorman now.
Colin Jost has walked away from head writer gig on "Saturday Night Live" to focus soley on the writing and anchoring "Weekend Update," the sketch comedy show's faux newscast.
As of Saturday's episode hosted by Tracy Morgan, Jost was not listed as a top dog in the credits alongside co-headwriters, Bryan Tucker and Rob Klein.
"He wasn't demoted," an industry source told The Daily News, "He chose to focus on `Weekend Update and is still a writer on `SNL.'"
The change was reflected in Saturday's end credits and on the show's official Website, the comedy site Splitsider first reported.
Jost has written for SNL since season 31 and was promoted to head writer during season 38 in 2012-2013.
A rep for "SNL" declined to comment.
